example.text: It's hailing dip'n'dots in Longmont right now.

roleset.name: recognize and honor
roleset.note: HAIL-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls characterize-29.2, judgement-33. (from hail.02-v)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: It is interesting to see [the fundamental stock pickers]-1 scream ``foul'' on program trading when the markets decline, while *trace*-1 hailing the great values still abounding as the markets rise.
example.arg: the great values still abounding as the markets rise

example.name: with arg2
example.text: Analysts hailed the planned transaction as being beneficial to Armstrong and Shaw.
example.arg: as being beneficial to Armstrong and Shaw

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: Lone Star 's Bond Corp. parent , for instance , hails from Perth , Australia .

roleset.name: summon
roleset.note: HAIL-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ. Member of Vncls 60. Comparison to summon. (from hail.05-v)

role.descr: hailed to do what (proposition not destination)

example.name: standard transitive
example.text: We talked after I hailed his Jeep marked with the U.N. flag .
example.arg: his jeep marked with the U.N. flag

example.name: all args
example.text: A group of soldiers hailed him *trace* to come ashore .

example.name: with goal
example.text: Glad to return, tho' hope could grant no more, And chains and torture hailed him to the shore.

roleset.name: hard things coming down
roleset.note: HAIL_DOWN-V NOTES: I doubt it will appear in WSJ, but here it is just for completeness. (from hail.03-v)

example.name: poor John
example.text: A series of cruel comments, and pointy rocks, hailed down on John.
example.arg: A series of cruel comments, and pointy rocks
